cyclone.name: CHRIS
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi (255 km) south of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander just off the North Carolina coast for 2–3 days, then accelerate northeastward well away from the U.S. coastline.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall expected; center should remain offshore of the North Carolina coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer Banks and portions of the North Carolina and mid-Atlantic coasts will experience increasing surf and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤3%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor swell-driven water rise of 1–2 ft on open beaches possible; no significant surge expected inside the Cape Fear River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer rainbands could bring 0.5–1.5 inches of rain; widespread flooding not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf will pose safety risks to port personnel and recreational users.
